channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cars constantly parking on double yellow lines & pavement., 21st January
item.description:
Cars regularly day & night illegally parking on double yellow lines & and on the pavement restricting entry/ exit into & out of BASTION ROAD, SE2. Cars parking illegally on the pavement outside the 2 shops on the corner of the junction limiting vision out of the junction & narrowing the pavement making it impossible for prams or invalid vehicles to pass. This junction needs to be patrolled by traffic wardens both day & night.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wickham Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road drain blocked flooding across road, 21st January
item.description:
Cars can’t pass without driving through

item.title: Loss of important items, 21st January
item.description:
I lost my Huawei Mate 60 phone (white) on the east side of Westminster Bridge, below the bridge. Has your road cleaning department found it? If so, please contact me.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Lambeth Palace Road, Waterloo, Greater London

item.title: Massive pothole, 21st January

item.title: Multiple potholes on Dunkery Rd, 21st January
item.description:
Multiple deep potholes on this stretch of Dunkery Road. Very busy road and bus route, holes get bigger and deeper each week. There are similar problems by the bus stop outside the flats where the buses pull in.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunkery Road, Mottingham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big holes developing around drain. Next to bus stop on NW direction (IE towards oval). Bus stop is named John Ruskin Street, 21st January
item.description:
Drain cover is working loose - every bus going over it is making it worse . It's already dangerous for cyclists and motorcyclist and getting more hazardous each day

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell New Road, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Large Pile of Bin Bags, 21st January

item.title: Rubbish Still Piling Up, 21st January
item.description:
Been a constant issue since the pharmacy opened. Pepe’s seem to mostly use the bins but there’s always random household looking bags dumped close by.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolwich Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Christmas Trees Dumped on Street, 21st January
item.description:
Residents have left their trees here, as they have done for the ladt 11 years, but this year Hackney Council have not removed them and they are till there. Please can they be collected.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Coster Avenue, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Strong smell coming from alley, 21st January
